Class ChessSquare

  • java.lang.Object
    • ChessSquare

  • public class ChessSquare
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds the information for each square. Holds all the methods to be able to make valid moves.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChessSquare(int _location, squareType _type)
      Generates a new instance of a chess square.

    • Method Summary

      Returns the square type of the square on the board.

      Returns the x location of the square on the board.

      Returns the y location of the square on the board.

      Moves the piece in the square to a new location.

      • canMoveTo

        public boolean canMoveTo(ChessSquare newSquare,
                ChessSquare[] newSquareArray)
        Calculates if the piece can move to the other square or not. It will return true if the square being searched if a valid move, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        newSquare - The new square.
        newSquareArray - The array of squares.
        Returns:
        If the piece can move to the other square or not.
